meanings.definition: To tread heavily or destructively upon
meanings.sent1: The elephant began to trample the tall grass in the jungle.
meanings.sent2: Please do not trample on the delicate flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy tried to trample through the mud puddle.
meanings.sent4: The crowd's excitement seemed to trample any sense of order.
meanings.sent5: The stampeding buffalo continued to trample everything in its path.

meanings.definition: To treat with contempt or rudeness
meanings.sent1: She felt hurt when her classmates would trample on her feelings.
meanings.sent2: It is not right to trample on someone's dreams and aspirations.
meanings.sent3: The rude customer seemed to trample over the waiter's patience.
meanings.sent4: His arrogant behavior would trample on anyone's sense of respect.
meanings.sent5: The bully's words seemed to trample on her self-esteem.

meanings.sent1: The hiker accidentally trampled on the tiny ant crawling on the path.
meanings.sent2: The heavy boots seemed to trample the fallen leaves on the forest floor.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy giant would trample on the tiny village without even noticing.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the world seemed to trample on his fragile spirit.
meanings.sent5: The relentless march of time can trample on even the strongest of memories.
